required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Efficiency Between I-gel Blind Intubation and I-gel Bronchoscopic Intubation During Resuscitation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Efficiency Between I-gel-Assisted Blind Intubation and I-gel-assisted Bronchoscopic Intubation During Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation: Randomized Simulation Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

clinical_study.source: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators will compare conventional intubation using Macintosh laryngoscope, blind endotracheal intubation using i-gel for conduit and bronchoscopic intubation using Ambu-aScope and i-gel. All situation assumed as cardiac arrest. i.e, someone give chest compressions continuously without interruption.
Moreover the investigators will compare the type of endotracheal tube. Reinforced tube has more soft tube tip, so the investigators think it is more acceptable for intubation using i-gel as conduit.

primary_outcome.description: 1st intubation attempt, an expected average time is 1 min.

arm_group.description: Intubation using Macintosh laryngoscope. we will check procedure time according to kind of endotracheal tube, separately. Two kinds of endotracheal tube will be used Conventional endotracheal tube Reinforced endotracheal tube

i-gel blind intubation means that blind endotracheal intubation will be performed after i-gel insertion. i-gel will be used as a conduit. we will check procedure time according to kind of endotracheal tube, separately. Two kinds of endotracheal tube will be used Conventional endotracheal tube Reinforced endotracheal tube

i-gel bronchoscopic intubation means that bronchoscopic endotracheal intubation will be performed after i-gel insertion. i-gel will be used as a conduit. we will check procedure time according to kind of endotracheal tube, separately. Two kinds of endotracheal tube will be used Conventional endotracheal tube Reinforced endotracheal tube

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- emergency physician
- work at emergency department more than 1 year.
- 50 or more experience of endotracheal intubation
Exclusion Criteria:
- having backache or wrist pain

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital
